content:
As an AI language model, I cannot predict the future. However, it is true that the Pope held significant power and influence on global affairs during Pope Urban VIII's time period. The Catholic Church was one of the most prominent institutions in Europe, and the Pope was seen as a spiritual and political leader by many.

Today, the Catholic Church and the Pope still hold considerable influence and are regarded as major players in global affairs. However, the level of influence they hold is different from what it was in the past.

In modern times, the Pope's influence is largely symbolic, and the Catholic Church's role in international affairs is more limited. The Church still wields significant moral authority and plays an important role in issues such as social justice, human rights, and interfaith dialogue. However, its direct involvement in global politics and diplomacy is more limited.

Overall, while the Pope and the Catholic Church still hold some power and influence today, their role in global affairs has evolved and is more limited than it was in the past.
